last_episode_to_air.name: Nature Week
last_episode_to_air.overview: With five bakers remaining, it's time for Nature Week and bakes that celebrate all things found in the great outdoors.

name: The Great Canadian Baking Show
overview: Canadian version of hit British baking competition. 10 amateur bakers from across Canada compete in a series of themed culinary challenges.

seasons.name: Specials
seasons.overview: A television special (often TV special, or rarely "television spectacular") is a stand-alone television show which temporarily interrupts episodic programming normally scheduled for a given time slot

episodes.name: Cake Week
episodes.overview: Ten of the country's most passionate bakers are welcomed to the iconic white baking tent to face Cake Week and demonstrate talent and skill in the first of many challenges.

episodes.name: Bread Week
episodes.overview: The bakers dive head first into a world of carbs as they tackle three difficult challenges for Bread Week.

episodes.name: Dessert Week
episodes.overview: Dessert Week allows the top eight bakers to shine in a series of sweet challenges.

episodes.name: Canada Week
episodes.overview: Canada Week sees the top seven bakers embrace beloved homegrown classics and show their national pride.

episodes.name: Best of Britain Week
episodes.overview: The Best of Britain challenges the bakers to replicate a trio of well-known British desserts.

episodes.name: Holiday Baking Week
episodes.overview: During Holiday Baking Week, the top five bakers celebrate and commemorate the season with three delectable holiday-themed challenges.

episodes.name: French Patisserie Week
episodes.overview: The top four semi-finalists face French Patisserie Week, with a series of technically difficult challenges that will determine the final top three bakers.

episodes.name: Finale
episodes.overview: In the finale, the top three Bakers face off to see who will be declared the inaugural winner of The Great Canadian Baking Show!

episodes.name: Cake Week
episodes.overview: Ten of the country's most passionate bakers enter the iconic white baking tent to face Cake Week and a series of challenges designed to reveal their skills and knowledge.

episodes.name: Biscuits and Bars Week
episodes.overview: It’s Biscuits and Bars Week, and the bakers have a chance to show off their ability and creativity.

episodes.name: Bread Week
episodes.overview: Bread Week finds the bakers elbow-deep in dough as they tackle a series of challenges.

episodes.name: International Week
episodes.overview: This week, the seven remaining bakers push themselves with challenges that feature flavours, textures and techniques from around the world.

episodes.name: Pastry Week
episodes.overview: This week, the remaining six bakers revel in Pastry Week and the opportunity to showcase their creativity.

episodes.name: Chocolate Week
episodes.overview: It’s Chocolate Week and the five remaining bakers seize the opportunity to make a statement with delectable chocolate creations.

episodes.name: French Patisserie Week
episodes.overview: The remaining four bakers must face French Patisserie Week, one of the most demanding weeks in the tent.

episodes.name: Finale
episodes.overview: The final three bakers return to the tent for the final showdown.

episodes.name: Cake Week
episodes.overview: CBC's The Great Canadian Baking Show returns with 10 of the country's most passionate bakers. They enter the iconic white baking tent to face Cake Week and a series of challenges.

episodes.name: Biscuit Week
episodes.overview: It's Biscuit Week and the bakers have a chance to show off their ability and creativity with cookies that will amaze!

episodes.name: Bread Week
episodes.overview: Bread Week finds the bakers elbow-deep in dough as they knead their way through a series of challenges.

episodes.name: Old School Week
episodes.overview: Come join us on the Great Canadian Baking Show time machine as the bakers try their hands at some classic treats.

episodes.name: Chocolate Week
episodes.overview: It's Chocolate Week and the remaining six bakers seize the opportunity to make a statement with delectable chocolate creations.

episodes.name: International Week
episodes.overview: This week, the five remaining bakers push themselves with challenges that feature flavours, textures and techniques from around the world.

episodes.name: Pie Week
episodes.overview: This week, the remaining four bakers revel in Pie Week and the opportunity to showcase their creativity.

episodes.name: Finale
episodes.overview: The final three bakers return to the tent for the final showdown.

episodes.name: Cake Week
episodes.overview: Ten bakers arrive to the tent and complete three Cake Week challenges.

episodes.name: Bread Week
episodes.overview: It's Bread Week once again and the nine remaining bakers must prove they can rise to the occasion.

episodes.name: Cookie Week
episodes.overview: Eight bakers face endless crunchy and crumbly possibilities for Cookie Week.

episodes.name: Italian Week
episodes.overview: Italian Week’s challenges transport the bakers across the pond to try their hand at timeless Italian treats.

episodes.name: Botanical Week
episodes.overview: Six remaining bakers face the first ever Botanical Week with three bakes that pay homage to all that’s garden-grown.

episodes.name: Pastry Week
episodes.overview: This week the remaining five bakers must show their layers and excel with their pastry-making skills in three Pastry Week bakes.

episodes.name: Fancy Desserts Week
episodes.overview: Only four bakers remain for the delicately delicious Fancy Desserts Week and their last bid to make it to the finale.

episodes.name: Finale
episodes.overview: The remaining bakers return to the Baking Tent for a final showdown.

episodes.name: Cake Week
episodes.overview: Ten of the country’s best amateur bakers arrive at the iconic Great Canadian Baking Show tent to complete three Cake Week challenges.

episodes.name: Cookie Week
episodes.overview: Only eight bakers can continue after completing three tough cookie challenges.

episodes.name: Celebration Week
episodes.overview: The baking tent gets festive for the first-ever Celebration Week with holiday and special occasion-themed challenges.

episodes.name: Bread Week
episodes.overview: The seven remaining bakers must prove they can rise to the occasion.

episodes.name: Pie and Tart Week
episodes.overview: This week the remaining six bakers must excel at pastry and not flake out in three Pie and Tart Week bakes.

episodes.name: Caramel Week
episodes.overview: Five bakers face off in the Baking Tent with three bakes dedicated to everything sticky and sweet.

episodes.name: Patisserie Week
episodes.overview: Only four bakers remain for the delicately delicious Patisserie Week and their last bid to make it to the finale.

episodes.name: Finale Week
episodes.overview: The final three bakers return to the tent for the final bakes of the season to determine who will win The Great Canadian Baking Show!

episodes.name: Cake Week
episodes.overview: Ann Pornel and Alan Shane Lewis host ten of the country's best amateur bakers in the baking tent; esteemed Judges Kyla Kennaley and Bruno Feldeisen declare the first Star Baker of the season, and decide which baker is first to leave the tent.

episodes.name: Biscuits and Cookies
episodes.overview: Bakers create meringue bars featuring a cookie base and a filling of their choice; the pressure is on during the Technical Challenge; the bakers must tell a story using only cookies with their whimsical fairy tale scene.

episodes.name: Bread Week
episodes.overview: Bread Week has arrived; each baker will show their stuff with stuffed flat breads; a Swedish tea ring for coffee time; the bakers must create an edible bread work of art.

episodes.name: Botanical Week
episodes.overview: Bakers must prepare pressed flower cookies featuring an edible flower or herb baked into them; bakers are tasked with making Chebakia; the bakers fool the judges's eyes with a botanical illusion cake.

episodes.name: Chocolate Week
episodes.overview: The bakers must re-create the Sacher Torte; the bakers must hide a dessert within a chocolate shell for Kyla and Bruno to discover in the 3D chocolate reveal.

episodes.name: Pastry Week
episodes.overview: The bakers demonstrate their take on a chimney cake; bakers rise to great heights with a baklava tower, built using phyllo pastry; one baker will wow the judges to become Star Baker and another sees their journey in the baking tent come to an end.

episodes.name: Fancy Dessert Week
episodes.overview: Four remaining bakers dress up some desserts; the bakers start with mochi donuts, then provide their take on the sans rival; the bakers must wow the judges with a jelly art cake, topped with a spectacle encased in jelly.

episodes.name: Finale
episodes.overview: Bakers demonstrate their abilities by taking on the classic Paris Brest; bakers try their hand at cassata; the bakers push their skills to the limit with a garden party dessert centerpiece made of at least three different bakes.

episodes.name: Cake Week
episodes.overview: Ten of the country's best amateur bakers arrive at the iconic "Great Canadian Baking Show" tent to complete three "Cake Week" challenges.

episodes.name: Bread Week
episodes.overview: It's Bread Week once again, and the nine remaining bakers knead to prove their bread-iness.

episodes.name: Cookie Week
episodes.overview: Eight bakers hope that bite-sized treats are their cup of tea as they enter Cookie Week.

episodes.name: Harvest Week
episodes.overview: Seven remaining bakers face the inaugural Harvest Week with three bakes celebrating nature's bounty.

episodes.name: Old School Week
episodes.overview: It’s totally tubular in the tent with the return of Old School Week as the six bakers are steeped in nostalgic bakes.

episodes.name: Spice Week
episodes.overview: Five bakers awaken their senses for the first-ever Spice Week, featuring three aromatic and seasoned bakes.

episodes.name: Patisserie Week
episodes.overview: The four remaining bakers get fancy for Patisserie Week and the last chance to make it to the finale.

episodes.name: Finale
episodes.overview: Three baker finalists step into the tent to determine who will win "The Great Canadian Baking Show."

episodes.name: Cake Week
episodes.overview: Ten of Canada's amateur bakers arrive at the Baking Tent to start their quest for the cake plate.

episodes.name: Cookie Week
episodes.overview: Nine bakers attempt to wow the judges with flavour-packed, bite-sized treats as they enter Cookie Week.

episodes.name: Savoury Week
episodes.overview: Eight bakers leave the sweets behind for The Great Canadian Baking Show’s first Savoury Week, highlighting the spicy, salty and cheesy.

episodes.name: Coffee and Tea Week
episodes.overview: The judges introduce Coffee and Tea Week to the Tent in homage to the flavours and traditions of this cross-cultural ritual.

episodes.name: Arts and Crafts Week
episodes.overview: Six bakers remain and will channel their inner artist to create bakes using traditional arts and crafts styles and techniques.

episodes.name: Nature Week
episodes.overview: With five bakers remaining, it's time for Nature Week and bakes that celebrate all things found in the great outdoors.
